column4: does anybody have any ideas on how I can bring my CPU temp down? since installing 6.06 it idles at 60
lsmod |grep cpufreq_userspace tell me what that say
sorry 4696 0
ok sudo powernowd -m 2
this will make pc slower but temp lower too
i dont think I have cpufreq installed, one sec
from what you said it is add it to the pannel to be sure
got to go sys here is highy undstable
exit
when i run the powernowd command i get: PowerNowd encountered and error and could not start.
Please make sure that:
- You are running a v2.6.7 kernel or later
- That you have sysfs mounted /sys
- That you have the core cpufreq and cpufreq-userspace
modules loaded into your kernel
- That you have the cpufreq driver for your cpu loaded,
(for example: powernow-k7), and that it works. Check
'dmesg' for errors.
If all of the above are true, and you still have problems,
please email the author: clemej@alum.rpi.edu

can you help me with powernowd
